summary: The Foster Youth Mentoring Act of 2025 aims to support programs that provide mentoring to children and youth in and with experience in foster care. It authorizes grants to eligible entities (nonprofits, state agencies, etc.) who provide mentoring services, with detailed requirements including mentor training, screening, and program design. The bill outlines application criteria, considerations for awarding grants, permissible uses of funds, and mandates an annual report to Congress. It also authorizes appropriations for the program.
